thread.title: OPPO F3 Plus with dual 16MP and 8MP selfie cameras launched, yours for Rs 30,990
thread.title_full: OPPO F3 Plus with dual 16MP and 8MP selfie cameras launched, yours for Rs 30,990

title: OPPO F3 Plus with dual 16MP and 8MP selfie cameras launched, yours for Rs 30,990
text:
OPPO F3 Plus with dual 16MP and 8MP selfie cameras launched, yours... OPPO F3 Plus with dual 16MP and 8MP selfie cameras launched, yours for Rs 30,990 By - March 23, 2017 “The F3 Plus flaunts a 6-inch FHD display, 4GB RAM, 64GB storage and a 16MP rear snapper” 
OPPO has launched its latest selfie-centric smartphone called the F3 Plus in India. It is the brand’s first smartphone to flaunt two selfie cameras – a 16MP shooter accompanied by an 8MP snapper. The phone’s secondary front camera features a 120-degree wide angle lens to help you capture better group shots. As for the primary shooter, the device gets a 16-megapixel snapper at the rear with an IMX398 sensor with Dual Pixel autofocus and a dual-tone LED flash. 
Coming to the other specs, the OPPO F3 Plus features a large 6-inch full HD display with a layer of Corning Gorilla Glass 5 on top. The phone is powered by an octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 653 SoC, coupled with 4GB of RAM. It comes with 64GB of storage, which is further expandable up to 256GB by inserting a microSD card. 
Connectivity-wise, the F3 Plus offers 4G LTE and dual-SIM slots. It boots ColorOS 3.0 based on Android 6.0 Marshmallow. A 4,000mAh battery with VOOC fast charging technology keeps the phone running. 
The OPPO F3 Plus has been priced at Rs 30,990, and will go on sale tomorrow on Amazon India, Flipkart and Snapdeal, and in major brick and mortar stores across the country. The phone is being offered in gold and rose gold hues. Facebook Comments
